comments.html: Agreed, this is meaningless - "v4 is faster", "v6 is faster" and "v4/v6 are tied" are around 30 percent each, so technically, yes, IPv6 is faster in about 1/3 of measurements, but it means absolutely nothing...
comments.name: paketb0te

comments.html: IMO it's just another product placement. The company or its founder should release raw data of "research" so people can verify. Too many varying factors to make such a statement.
comments.name: Anonymous
